column11: Review Text
How is the stadium after the storm? I hear kandy as a whole has been badly affected.Does anybody know if the england/sri lanka T20 will still be happening in feb 2026
one of well constructed main stadium in Kandy and Central Province. Nothing to watch other than the cricket match.

We have watched few matches including T20 - Sri Lanka vs West Indies 2020. The ground is superb and has all the amenities you need. The atmosphereÂ is superb. Excellent views throughout the ground. Better if you avoid parking the car inside if you do not have VIP pass since you may stuck in terrible traffic. Would 100% recommend if you're in the area at the time of a game.
Beautiful location and ground. amazing atmosphere during matches. if you are a fan of cricket one of best places to watch a match.

We have watched cricket here a couple of times including the 4th ODI between England and Sri Lanka in October 2018. The lower grandstands gave a good view of the game with the beer and food available just behind the seating area. The upper grandstands provide better shelter from the rain than the lower grandstands, hence the higher prices.

We went here to watch the 2nd T20 between Sri Lanka and New Zealand, and we weren't disappointed. The ground is superb and has all the amenities you need. The atmosphere is electric, and the sight of so many people crammed on to the bank is breathtaking. We sat in the main stand for just 2000Rs, and despite having to move because we were originally positioned right behind a cameraman, we got a fabulous view of the game and the HUGE scoreboard. Would 100% recommend if you're in the area at the time of a game...just leave yourself time to leave the car park at the end of the game (it took us about an hour!).

column8: fantastic stadium to watch test match cricket, had a wonderful time with England before xmas..beautiful scenery....
column11: This stadium ticked all the boxes for me as a cricket fan, good views from all round the stadium, good choice of very cheap grass banking or seats, pretty good catering, cheap beer etc and quick service...the only slight drawback being was not much outside if you want to go out at lunch, so best to grab a tuk tuk after the game and head back to your hotel, but overall very enjoyable, recommend..(take plenty of sunscreen) it's seriously hot

column8: Good stadium albeit a bit isolated
column11: Reasonable facilities for a Sri Lankan stadium. Nice grass bank to sit on and good views all round. Easy bus journey to get there but other than a convenience store across road not much else about.

column8: Mixed weather for 1 day cricket international
column11: We were fortunate to see  cricket played antil 4 p.m. in the swealtering heat but then within seconds the monsoon rain came and washed out the game.

We watch the Second Test, Sri Lanka v. England - and England won an exciting game!Only two drawbacks: 1) We were in an air-conditioned box which had access to covered external seating at the front of the box. On Day 1 it took some time to persuade the authorities to unlock the door so that we could get access to the seats in front that we had paid for! They seemed quite happy, though, for us to go to the box next door and climb over the low wall separating our box from theirs! What is more, that low wall was - how can I put it - at exactly the wrong height for average-height gentlemen to cross in comfort 2) Our catering in the box offered beer or coke (only). When we asked for diet coke, they went and got what they claimed as was diet coke - but wasn't. This isn't just annoying, it's dishonest and potentially dangerous. It was not until Day 4 of the match that we managed to convince them that Diet Coke (along with Diet Fanta and two other diet drinks) was available on the ground and in fact was cheaper than the full-sugar version!;

This is what test cricket is all about. Lying on the grass bank watching cricket and getting a sun tan with a pint in your hand. The staff were all very pleasant. The only downside was the tuk tuk rides from Kandy, even more so in torrential rain on the way back. One point for visitors is that opposite the ground is a little shop / cafe with amazing egg rotis
I was there for the Sri Lanka versus England test match. Excellent views of the match but mediocre stadium catering (only burgers and hot dogs- this is Sri Lanka, not Skegness!)
A proper test ground with all the facilities you would expect. Toilets even have toilet paper ( thatâ€™s different ) .... excellent views throughout the ground

I spent the afternoon watching the rain fall on the large blue plastic covers which were protecting the ground from the rain, When the rain eased the Ground Staff did a wonderful job clearing the plastic sheeting to allow play to start in the evening, which in itself was interesting. A wonderful ground!
Great Stadium. Loads of room on the grass with great views. Good atmosphere with friendly locals. Food wasn't great though but the beer was cheap.

Went to the Second England Sri Kanka Test. A great match but this vanity project of a stadium is so far out of Kandynthat very few Sri Lankanâ€™s make it out here for the cricket, why do these countries and the World Cricket governing bodies abuse their local cricket fans so much by building these places miles from the population? Nonsense!

Loved the ground, easy to get to from Kandy with a tuk tuk, amenities all new so plenty of toilets etc. View of the cricket is great and it has a real charm about it. Seats are inexpensive and stay in the shade pretty much all day. The grass bank is fun if you have hats/ blankets and a lot of sunscreen as gets the sun pretty all day. Food options were slightly limited but walk out of the ground and there are a few little local bakeries/ stalls/ shops where you can get extremely inexpensive samosas, roti, curry etc.
A lovely modern stadium easy to book on line Â£15 for the best seats, Limited fod & beverages Beer and Hot Dogs
A lovely ground, with great views of the game, hats and umbrellas definitely needed as the weather can be really hot. Everyone was nice and friendly.
The facilities are not first class but reasonable. The food and drink is very reasonably priced and the atmosphere is superb.
Nice stadium some distance outside kandy worth thinking about getting taxis there and back beer cheap inside the ground
A beautiful newly constructed cricket stadium built outside the cities with all modern amenities....
Went to watch the SLvSA 4ODI match at this stadium and it was excellent. We were seated at the grand stand and the view was perfect. But don't try to buy the VIP box tickets.. not worth.
Watched 2 one dayers here Lanka v South Africa. First game we sat on the grass bank with all the locals, atmosphere was magic and second game up in the grandstand. A beautiful ground to watch a game!
This is a beautiful Cricket grounds here.Come here if you are  a cricket fan or to watch a cricket match.
This looked like it would be a beautiful cricket stadium but you cannot get in to have a look and there are no view points of it from the outside.
i have been there for watch cricket matches held by ICC. this place is surrounded by nice and Natural fresh mountains. it's view is great.

i have visited there for few times for ODI, Test & T20 matches. comparing to other international cricket grounds i have visited this is the best and well maintained cricket ground in Sri lanka. nearly 40 min drive from Kandy. set in scenic surroundings, great view from the grand stand and grass areas. wash rooms are clean, also there are outlet stores for live cooking, so nothing to worry about meals. also you can enjoy a Cool Beer for cheap price. kids can enjoy Ice cream.  in my last visit one ticket price was 750rs for grand stand, really worth with best view. if you wish to stay in grass areas better you bring hat or umbrella sometimes there might be a little shower or drizzle but will not effect much for the Cricket. if you visit by your own vehicle nothing to worry about parking, there are many parking areas, also houses close to the ground provide parking facilities for cheap rate. so this is an excellent cricket ground, it's a Heaven for Cricket Lovers - will come again !!

I visited here to see a ODI between India and Sri Lanka. It's pretty cheap to get in, I paid 500 lkr for a ticket and probably could get it for less. The crowd came in as the game went by so by the last 2-3 hours the stadium was fairly packed. Despite the fact Sri Lanka lost fairly comfortably there was a great vibe from the crowd. I am not a huge cricket fan but it was a fun day out. It's 11km outside Kandy so it's a bit of a journey, getting back is tough as 20,000 are all trying to get on same buses back to Kandy. If you get the chance worth checking a game out here.

As a cricket lover, i went to watch a match between local college teams. Stadium is located near to Kandy city with some breathtaking views. If you are in Kandy, its a must visit place if you love cricket.

An excellent cricketing experience in this international stadium. The view from the grand stand is very good and in the shade. My ratings would be higher if the busy and narrow approach roads were upgraded. Be ready for a long haul from the city or north of the city. I attended a match which had a small crowd but the toilet facilities were not maintained during the game, resulting in poor conditions. Be prepared..!!
We like cricket and we were able to see this ground. Unfortunately, we were not able to get in, but still worth it
I enjoyed our day at this stadium.  its a bit of a drive out of Kandy, but for a cricket fan is worth it.
you may heard murai. he has many connections with this ground. sanga also have record here. big ground. nice to view matches if the weather is good.
the stadium is located in the hill station and is a beautiful place to watch cricket match with the hills in the background.

Awesome stadium, great atmosphere. We loved the 2 games we watched there. Beers were $2 AUD and the food, whilst not great in variety was fine. Seating is good on both lever 1 and 2. Both scoreboards don't show the same thing, probably should. Much better than R.Premadasa. Leave plenty of time before arriving on match day as the roads in get very crazy.
Pallekelle is the one of the most beautiful cricket stadium in Sri Lanka. Capacity of the ground is very high. Beautiful place with all facilities.
This is the best venue for T20 matches in Sri Lanka..Book middle seats in grand stand for a better view.

Having always dreamt of watching my favourite team live in their home conditions, i was excited for the game to get going. We had pre-booked seats online and selected a spot where according to the seat map on bookmyshow.lk we had the last seats in the row. These were selected as we had our 14 month old daughter with us as we could then use the space for her stroller. Stadium facilities were really good with good security on arrival , efficient ticket collection at the office and well layed out and marked directions to the seating areas. On arrival at our seats we found completely different setup as compared to the layout provided. Many fans from the grass embankments had slid through some gaps in the barrier to occupy the additional seats. Police officers really couldnt do much to keep track of who was meant to be there and who wasnt. The seats and viewing area were great. Fans were generally very enthusiastic and respectful bar one character who clearly had a few too many lion lagers ðŸ˜Š. This is generally the case at international games, but this guy was a pest of note and clearly was one of the original "sliders" as mentioned earlier. Exiting the stadium was well managed and ofcourse the traffic itself meant a few extra minutes more than on arrival. I have been to many cricket matches and I should say that this was by far the easiest to access and exit which is great when having little kids with you. The result didnt go our way but the experience was very good. Crowd control could be better in terms of segregation of the areas and looking into the controls around both the ticketing layouts and potential zones for breach.

We went to the t20 game last night and loved the stadium (and the game) got some tickets at a massivly inflated price (that was fine... still less than at home) on 'the hill' we were the only foreigners in our section but didnt feel too out of place. Not a second sitting down for the 4 hrs tho. Food was fine... hot dogs ice creams and kfc on the way in and brought around during the game. Tuk tuk from kandy was 1000lkr there but on the way back we took some sort of shortcut which knocked off half the time. I assume we went the scenic way there. No worries as price was pre negotiated. One word of warning for fmls. I was with my husband in the throng of people leaving and had people grabbing me all.over in the crush and darkness. I was dressed conservativly with pants and a high neck top and it has been the only time i felt unsafe in SL. We jumped in a tuk tuk and got out of there but i would recommend pre organising a tuk tuk to be waiting at the gate if you are leaving at night.

As a pair of Honeymooning Brits, we didnt expect to take in a test match, but as we were passing through Kandy, I convinced my driver to let us stop by. What a beautiful ground it was, and very modern as well, with excellent amenities. Excellent value for money too

We had some spare time in Kandy and Australia happened to be playing a test match so we went one afternoon out to Pallekele stadium to watch. We are more baseball fans so had fun comparing the rules and similarities/differences between the two games with our driver. Parking was not an issue and there were plenty of seats available. Even the more expensive seats were very reasonably priced. The ground is fairly simple with a grandstand on one side and grassy banks on the other from where you can bring a picnic sit and watch. Unfortunately for us we were only treated to a small part of the match before a rain cloud started to move in and bad light stopped play. Still, a nice experience if you get the chance.

Enjoyed three days of the test match Australia and Sri Lanka... Great viewing areas in the grandstand and grassed areas... Food and beverages need some attention on match day though... Need a large crowd for atmosphere though..

The stadium is about 40 minutes out of Kandy but once you get there it's worth it.  The grandstand has a good cross breeze so is very cooling. The wash rooms are clean but (in the ladies at least) didn't have toilet paper, just a hose!  You have been warned. Not much food for sale there, the stands sell all the same food.  But the icecreams are cheap and so by the looks of it was the beer. We went and unfortunately the Aussies lost, but the ground had a good screen so we could confirm that yes, they really did play that poorly.

I attended the first day of the first test between Sri Lanka & Australia and was very impressed with the ground and the grand stand. We had great seats in the grand stand with good viewing of the whole ground. The surrounding areas were also good.
I was on cricket game Sri Lanka vs Australia. The ticket price was 100rp for standing and 200rp for seats. Stadium is clean and safe.

I enjoyed watching all five days of the recent Sri Lanka v Australia Test Match at this beautiful ground. Food options are extremely limited but for a Rs500 seat in an air-conditioned box, this is hardly cause for complaint. With BYO food, it was a fantastic venue to watch Test Cricket. Pity about the result :(

Smiling faces greeted us at the stadium which has improved from my last visit.Facilities are much better.Wash rooms clean food and drink facilities sufficient with easy access. Organised and .What a shameell Equipped.Aussies present were full of praise. Blame the people of kandy that fail to watch cricket in this beautiful grounds,

Stadium is clean and well maintained - even the bathrooms! There isn't a bad seat in the house. Lawn areas around the outside seem free and open to the public - lots of families with kids picnicking there. Beer and ice cream are cheap :) Tip: very light on food offerings so bring your own snacks
Couldnt watch any match but its really beautiful, a must visit place for all cricket fans though its a small one.

For cricket-lovers, a must-visit spot. Set in scenic surroundings, with the old Dutch encampment and forts near at hand, it is indeed an awesome place to be in, even though you maybe the spouse accompanying your cricket-crazy wife/husband ! A visual delight in green.
This international cricket stadium in Kandy at the height of around 480 meters surrounded by mountains offers a very good views. Just if you have spare time you can visit this place.
most beautyfull cricket stadium in sri lanka. locat in pallekele. ( 20 minuts drive from kandy city center )
Great place... watched several matches.. looks awesome and lobe to see a good match there back again.
Srilankan have a great love for Cricket .it is compulsory sport in school . This is a famous stadium with beautiful scenic beauty all around .
There are good views from the stands and from the grass areas.  It always rains, of course but they have a big cover and usually start playing again as soon as the rain stops
I know nothing much about cricket but I enjoyed the afternoon spent here watching a game of cricket, most pleasant.
A good ground in a good place. Enough space and not in a busy environment. Situated close to the BOI zone.
good parking space, lot of greenery easily approachable, food available;e at the premises, cool kandy climate

Crowd is amazing and really active. It's about 11 km away from the Kandy town. Public transport is available. However, Be there early if you are going by private vehicles. Roads near the place could get crowded.

Went to see Sri Lanka vs Pakistan T20, what an occasion! The Sri Lankans are mad for cricket and the whole crowd made the atmosphere amazing. All the local people were really friendly. The tickets were also surprisingly cheap!
This is one big international stadium, best in Sri Lanka they say and pretty sure it is compared to the location and having seen the number in crowd.
easy access to the place from kandy city. Few km. have facilities for day and night matches too. In the new kandy main city kundasale.

What a majestic ground. A good 30-40 min out of Kandy town itself but dont let that deter you. The ground is beautiful with one of the best backdrops in cricket. The sunset views behind the hills are majestic. The Kandy crowd are also always really good fun, win or loose they booze and have great fun :)

This is the most beautiful cricket stadium in the country.When you are there you just not only enjoying the cricket but you enjoy the stunning view as well. Compare to other stadiums in Sri Lanka this is much clean as well.

If you are a cricket lover, it is about 1 hours drive from Kandy to the stadium by public transport during the day,and by taxi it will cost about Â£7.00. Very nice ground and many international matches played throughout the year.
Surrounded by misty mountains ,easy access & well maintained cricket ground.Good venue for test cricket & one day international.
Panaromic View.Splendid with a friendly staff.poo on catering.No substantial eating opportunity. Brilliant scoreboard.Ground maintinance very good
The location is great.Our stay was brief and the match we watched was test match without much crowd hence the ground facilities were not actually tested,

Watched the England game. Unfortunately was rained off at the end of Sri Lanka innings. The facilities are great inside. Everything you need. Clean toilets, plenty of cheap food and drink vendors. And at the end of the game so easy to get a bus home again.
It is intended only nice and green ground Ã¬ had ever seen.Plenty of spectator's can stay. But pallekale is not in kandy city.have to travel 30 minutes from the city
fairly identikit construction from the last world cup - but a stunning setting to watch cricket. England actually won a game and Sangakkara scored a fantastic century. Warm welcome from the locals.

If you are a cricket fan try and coincide your trip with an actual game, it is worth the effort as watching the cricket with the locals was one of our highlights in Sri Lanka and the stadium was great.

There doesn't seem like a bad seat in the entire ground. Although it's a bit of a drive out of Kandy, especially if you are using a tuk or bus, the location is wonderful and the ground well designed to give you a good view of the surrounding areas. The entrance is well kept, covered by beautiful arching trees. the ground itself offers you a very intimate experience as the boundary ropes are practically on the edge of the spectator's area. The grass banks offer a colourful, sound-filled atmosphere, while the stand probably gives you more comfort with just as good a view.

My boyfriend and I attended the first England v Sri Lanka ODI here.  It was easy to buy tickets from the booth on the day of the match.  Though tourists do pay more you can choose which price tier to opt for.  The ground has a beautiful setting with lovely views of the overlooking hills.  Attendants were very helpful the whole day. The refreshments were cheap and plentiful.  The beer was very cheap, but they had lovely iced tea and ice creams/lollys too.  Some people weren't a fan of the food but I quite liked the hot dogs and chips they had. Ladies - the ladies loo's are not marked apart from men's one but the attendants will direct you.  But the ones in the stand were proper loo's not long drops thankfully.  Bring tissues as it runs out. Also I was followed in to the loo by some young lads - luckily an older woman had come out of the loo at the time and in a very stern school teacher voice told them loudly that this was a ladies loo.  So maybe have someone wait outside for you.  This was the only time I felt uneasy the whole of my trip.  And only the once during the two days I was at the cricket in Kandy. But I felt worth mentioning. However, on a better note I got chatting to some lovely people during the match and had a wonderful time.  It was one of the best days of my trip. (plus England won)  I found the home fans to be really friendly.  I even got asked to have my picture with quite a few people.  Great memories.  Hopefully I'll be back again

column7: Layer de la Haye, United Kingdom
column11: We took the bus from the lake (bottom side of the lake opposite the Tooth Temple) for two of the England-Sri Lanka ODI.   Just ask any of the drivers for Pallekelle and they'll tell you which bus to get on.  With minor traffic it took around 30 minutes (but we stood both times - lots of folks going to cricket!) If you've reserved a ticket, then you pick them up by the main entrance (to the right of the security check), through a barred gate.  Take your invoice or an electronic copy of it. It's a lovely ground.  We were in B Lower both times and it was a great view.  Hint - if there's anything looking like rain on the horizon make sure you pick a seat that's going to be protected by the grandstand roof.  Once you've got your seat, you can't really leave it (unless you leave someone behind to hold it for you). Going to cricket at Pallekelle is like going to a Sri Lankan party.  Great fun.  (even when it rains). Lion Beer is cheap at 200 LKR for a large beer or 120 LKR for a smaller one.  Ice creams for 50 LKR.  Apart from that food options are appallingly bad.  Do yourself a favor and take food with you - the security bag check don't bother about food and soft drinks (not sure about beer though) - otherwise your options are hot dogs, fries and fish rolls. Buses to return to Kandy will be packed, so either head away from Kandy to the previous stop and try and get on there, or get yourself a tuktuk - you'll probably be paying 1000 LKR to return to Kandy if it's busy.  Or if you're extremely lucky like we were, find yourself a Sri Lankan family who has room in their car and wants to talk cricket..
Went out to watch 2 ODI cricket games against England. Beautiful setting lovely views. Good refreshments available,
Lovely stadium and a must see for all cricket fans :-D very proud of my country and of my province, much beauty and wow very very nicely built stadium!!

being South African cricket fans we were dissapointed not to be allowed access. We had to look through two sets of security fencing across a moat . It is some distance from the city so unless there is a match it seems pretty pointless to go.
Had the privilege of watching SL vs SA cricket match. The atmosphere was electric, the surrounding scenery was breathtaking.
im going there sri lanka vs Bangladesh  match.the ground was so bautifull.there have parking lot.enjoy match well.
For a low ranked club team to play there was an honour - this newish stadiun=m is a vast improvement on the old one.
whether a school field or galle's beautiful cricket ground (watch from the ramparts) it is one of the most impressive settingsfor a cricket ground in the world.

Of the idyllic settings I've been fortunate enough to watch cricket in, this ground is right up there. The hills provide a lovely backdrop, the grass banks an ideal place to sit and watch for a few hours and if the ground was packed with supporters, I can imagine the atmosphere would be electric. Only downside is that it is a 25 minute ride out of Kandy centre. But it's a cracking venue and a must-visit for cricket lovers.

The security staff was very helpful and gave us tickets for the vip enclosure. We somehow found our way to the booth after going up and down! Perfect place to mingle with locals and experience genuine hospitality. The kids loved it.

Went there to watch a cricket match between sri lanka and south Africa. the stadium is small surrounded by mountain ranges in the distance. A small stadium means that you dont need a binoculars to see the players. The only issue is the transport to and from the ground. Its about 10Km from the Kandy town and so you need to organize transport to get there and from the stadium. although I too the Digana bus from kandy and got off the stadium and on the way back took a tuk tuk.
Nice picturesque ground! Fabulous surrounding. Recently visited for a match desperately need to have a well organized parking facilities and improve the security at the grounds.
Another famous cricket stadium in Kandy which has come up in the recent past. Selected for International cricket matches and is very spacious and well maintained.
Amazing atmosphere, the crowd really supports the home team. Great seat at cheap price. Some confusion when buying tickets at gate. Crazy when leaving

The best Cricket stadium in Sri Lanka. Nice weather and excellent scenic view.. All the hills around the ground is simply breathtaking. Since the ground is not that big, you can see the match without any hassle.
